jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)suddenly become deranged or lose one's self-control
another way of saying &B{flick through}. (see flick)
To react strongly, as with anger or enthusiasm.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 反应强烈：如带着怒气或激情等强烈地反应

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (as a verb in the sense 'make a flick with the finger and thumb'): probably a contraction of fillip
late 17th cent.: perhaps from flip in the sense 'whip up'

entry.tran: 迅速打开(或关掉)(装置);按(开关)
entry.def: If you flip a device on or off, or if you flip a switch, you turn it on or off by pressing the switch quickly.

example.ex: He didn't flip on the headlights until he was two blocks away...
example.tran: 他开出两个街区后才打开车头灯。

example.ex: Then he walked out, flipping the lights off...
example.tran: 然后他走了出来，把灯关掉了。

entry.def: If you flip through the pages of a book, for example, you quickly turn over the pages in order to find a particular one or to get an idea of the contents.

example.ex: He was flipping through a magazine in the living room...
example.tran: 他在起居室里翻看着杂志。

example.ex: He flipped the pages of the diary and began reading the last entry.
example.tran: 他快速翻了一下那本日志，然后开始读最后一篇。

entry.def: If something flips over, or if you flip it over or into a different position, it moves or is moved into a different position.

example.ex: The plane then flipped over and burst into flames...
example.tran: 接着飞机突然翻转并燃起了大火。

example.ex: He flipped it neatly on to the plate.
example.tran: 他干净利索地把它盛到了盘子里。

entry.def: If you flip something, especially a coin, you use your thumb to make it turn over and over, as it goes through the air.

example.ex: I pulled a coin from my pocket and flipped it...
example.tran: 我从口袋里掏出一个硬币，把它弹向空中。

example.ex: I flipped a butt out of the window and drove on.
example.tran: 我把烟蒂弹出车窗外继续开车。

entry.tran: 突然心烦意乱;勃然大怒
entry.def: If someone flips, they suddenly become extremely upset or angry because of something that has happened.

example.ex: He got so provoked that he flipped.

entry.tran: 轻率的;随便的;不严肃的
entry.def: If you say that someone is being flip, you disapprove of them because you think that what they are saying shows they are not being serious enough about something.

example.ex: The tone of the book is sometimes too flip.
example.tran: 这本书的笔调有些时候太不严肃了。

means.word_mean: 1. an acrobatic feat in which the feet roll over the head (either forward or backward) and return
2. hot or cold alcoholic mixed drink containing a beaten egg
3. the act of flipping a coin
4. a dive in which the diver somersaults before entering the water
5. (sports) the act of throwing the ball to another member of your team;
1. lightly throw to see which side comes up;

sentences.sentence: "I don't know what to do--I may as well flip a coin!"

means.word_mean: 2. cause to go on or to be engaged or set in operation;
3. look through a book or other written material;
4. toss with a sharp movement so as to cause to turn over in the air
5. cause to move with a flick;
6. throw or toss with a light motion;
7. move with a flick or light motion
8. turn upside down, or throw so as to reverse;
9. go mad, go crazy;

sentences.sentence: "He flipped when he heard that he was being laid off"

means.word_mean: 10. reverse (a direction, attitude, or course of action)
1. marked by casual disrespect;

sentences.sentence: "the student was kept in for impudent behavior"

auth_sentence.content: That wasn't the end of Yasay's flip-flop.
auth_sentence.res_content: That wasn't the end of Yasay's flip-flop.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That wasn't the end of Yasay's flip-flop.

auth_sentence.content: However, correlations are uncertain and may flip again.
auth_sentence.res_content: However, correlations are uncertain and may flip again.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: However, correlations are uncertain and may flip again.

auth_sentence.content: I like to walk into a hotel wearing flip-flops.
auth_sentence.res_content: I like to walk into a hotel wearing flip-flops.

想象过程中的自由形式语言
浮点翻译程序，浮点解释程序

Sentence.sentence: There's a flip side, however, as partners are more likely to become ill or die in the couple of years following their spouse's death, and caring for a spouse with mental disorder can leave you with some of the same severe problems.
On the flip side, companies like Virgin Galactic are plotting a bottom-up assault on the space dream by making it a reality to the public.

means.word_mean: 轻弹, 轻抛[扔]

sentences.en: They flipped a coin to decide who would go first.
sentences.cn: 他们用掷硬币的方法决定谁先去。

means.word_mean: 发疯, 失去理智

sentences.en: My brother really flipped after his experience in the war.
sentences.cn: 我兄弟经历战争之后真的发疯了。

means.word_mean: 急动，急拉，急扔；翻，翻动；(跳水时)作空翻

sentences.en: The truck ran off the road and flipped over in the ditch.
sentences.cn: 这辆卡车开出公路翻倒在沟里。

means.word_mean: 迅速翻阅书籍，翻动纸张；匆匆查看，草草翻阅，(迅速、随便地)浏览(常与through连用)

sentences.en: I haven't read the book properly,I just flipped through it to see what it was like.
sentences.cn: 我还没有认真看这本书，我只是浏览了一下看看它怎么样。

means.word_mean: 蹦蹦跳跳；(用鳍状肢或翅膀等)啪嗒啪嗒地走动，拍动

sentences.en: The seals flipped along the beach.
sentences.cn: 海豹沿着海滩啪嗒啪嗒地翻动着。

means.word_mean: [美国俚语](由于激动、愤怒、疯狂等而)失去自制力，精神失常，失去理智；发疯，发狂；变得狂热；欣喜若狂(常与 out 连用)

sentences.en: He flipped over his new girl friend.
sentences.cn: 他对新的女朋友爱得发狂。

jushi.english: I knew you'd flip when you saw my new car.
jushi.chinese: 我知道你看见我的新车会兴奋得发狂的。

jushi.english: The carter flipped at the horse with his whip.
jushi.chinese: 赶大车的人扬鞭朝着马轻轻地抽打。

jushi.english: My brother really flipped when I told him I'd smashed up his car.
jushi.chinese: 我告诉我哥哥我把他的车撞坏了,他果真大为光火。
